channel.title: Latest news
channel.copyright: 2020 CBS Interactive Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Less than half in Singapore willing to share COVID-19 results with contact tracing tech
item.description: Just 41% of Singaporeans are comfortable sharing a positive COVID-19 test result with contact tracing technology, though 55% -- the highest amongst six countries surveyed -- are willing to do so with their employer or school.

item.title: Coronavirus tracing tech policy 'more significant' than the war on encryption
item.description: COVID-19 apps that track individuals' movements and report them to a government server? What could possibly go wrong? Digital rights activists are starting to push back.

item.title: Australia looks to 'go harder' with use of COVID-19 contact tracing app
item.description: It is eyeing Singapore's TraceTogether app that documents the interactions of individuals via Bluetooth.

item.title: AFP used Clearview AI facial recognition software to counter child exploitation
item.description: Seven officers have conducted searches on the Clearview AI facial recognition platform.

item.title: Samsung pushes 8.5Gbps across 800MHz of 5G mmWave spectrum
item.description: Multi-user MIMO sees Samsung transfer 4.3Gbps of data to a pair of mobiles.

item.title: Apple releases Maps mobility data to help researchers track spread of COVID-19
item.description: The new tool provides mobility data for 'major cities and 63 countries or regions'.

item.title: Microsoft opens AccountGuard to healthcare providers on the COVID-19 front lines
item.description: Microsoft says the service will remain free for all healthcare organizations "until the COVID-19 pandemic subsides."

item.title: Conducting customer research remotely: Tips, tricks, and resources
item.description: Conducting research remotely has benefits.

item.title: Meet the iPhone SE2 and iCouch: Apple's service bundle for the pandemic
item.description: While Netflix, Amazon, and HBO have excellent content, they'd have a difficultly competing with a service like this from Apple.

item.title: How Verizon Media's networking team is handling COVID-19 supply chain challenges
item.description: "We had to create a DR plan for the DR plan," Verizon Media's Chief Network Architect said of the unprecedented global disruptions caused by the pandemic.

item.title: iDrive Cloud Backup deal: Pay $3.48 for 5TB and save 95% the first year
item.description: Looking for a personal or sole-proprietorship backup? Then this iDrive deal demands a look.

item.title: Microsoft April 2020 Patch Tuesday comes with fixes for three zero-days
item.description: Microsoft fixes another 113 bugs this month after patching a whopping 115 last month.

item.title: OnePlus 8 and 8 Pro: How to buy and where to find the best deals
item.description: The OnePlus 8 and 8 Pro goes on sale at OnePlus, Verizon, T-Mobile, and Amazon later this month.

item.title: Microsoft pushes back end of support date for Windows 10 1809
item.description: Microsoft is giving Windows 10 1809 users a reprieve on when they'll receive their final security updates. It also is postponing end of support for Windows Server 1809, SharePoint Server 2010 and more, all due to effects of the coronavirus.

item.title: Exclusive: Google removes 49 Chrome extensions caught stealing crypto-wallet keys
item.description: The Chrome extensions were mimicking cryptocurrency wallet apps like Ledger, MyEtherWallet, Trezor, Electrum, and others, but, in reality, they were stealing users' private keys and mnemonic phrases.

item.title: The best VPN services for your home office or any remote connection
item.description: VPNs aren't essential only for securing your unencrypted Wi-Fi connections in coffee shops and airports. Every remote worker should consider a VPN to stay safe online. Here are your top choices and how to get set up.

item.title: Roundup: Coronavirus COVID-19 pandemic delivers array of cybersecurity challenges
item.description: As the COVID-19 outbreak threatens to overload the healthcare system and the global economy, it's also having a powerful impact on the security of businesses and individuals.

item.title: The best email hosting services: G Suite and Microsoft 365 are not your only options
item.description: Are you a small business or home office worker ready to graduate from free email offerings, present a professional address, and exert some control over your business communications? Then you'll want to sign up with an email hosting provider.

item.title: Jason Squared podcast and video series on ZDNet
item.description: ZDNet's Jason Cipriani and Jason Perlow discuss and debate all things current in the business tech space.

item.title: Accenture and Verizon announce B2B platform to match laid off workers with open positions
item.description: Human resource officers built the service to help the 16 million people unemployed due to the coronavirus.
